messages.subject: What's New at HowStuffWorks, 09/17/01
messages.msgSnippet: What s New at HowStuffWorks September 17, 2001 http://www.howstuffworks.com Hello . September 11, 2001 will be remembered as one of the most horrific days in
messages.messageBody:
What's New at HowStuffWorks
September 17, 2001
http://www.howstuffworks.com

Hello .

September 11, 2001 will be remembered as one of the most horrific
days in U.S. history. The events of this day certainly affect every
American, and likely will affect every person in the world in some
way. Everyone at HowStuffWorks expresses their deepest sympathy to
the families of the victims in this tragedy.

The three articles published last week help you to understand
different aspects of what happened on September 11. This week, one
article that has been getting particular attention is "How Stocks and
the Stock Market Work," located at:

http://www.howstuffworks.com/stock.htm

See also:

How Black Boxes Work
http://www.howstuffworks.com/black-box.htm

How Nuclear Bombs Work
http://www.howstuffworks.com/nuclear-bomb.htm

How Skyscrapers Work
http://www.howstuffworks.com/skyscraper.htm

Three HowStuffWorks articles have come online since the
last newsletter.

Terrorism -
http://www.howstuffworks.com/terrorism.htm
In the wake of the September 11 attack on the United States, the
attention of the world has turned to the universal dilemma of
terrorism and how to deal with it.

September 11, 2001 -
http://www.howstuffworks.com/sept-eleven.htm
September 11, 2001 will be remembered as one of the most
horrific and shocking days in U.S. history.

Osama bin Laden -
http://www.howstuffworks.com/bin-laden.htm
There is widespread suspicion that Osama bin Laden was
responsible for the September 11 terrorist attack.

-------------------------------------------------------------------

Here is a list of the new surveys added to the survey archive at
http://www.howstuffworks.com/survey-archive.htm :
- What do you feel would be an appropriate U.S. response to the
Sept. 11 attack?

Sincerely,
Marshall Brain
